content.description: The route is a pure scramble save for a final airy section on good rock
content.protection: Bring protection only if you bring a rope (not likely).  Gear will be sparse, at any rate.
content.location: Past Cabezon drop down on a road to the right, park across from the west face of Guadalupe & negotiate past several bands of dirt cliff, aiming for the obvious talus gully.  At the col head out left on some exposed but good quality rock to the summit.

content.description: The second easiest plug to get to in the Rio Puerco Valley, similar to Cabezon but less rock & more scrambling.
